intro: Hiraea ternifolia var. ternifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved hiraea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies, and has trifoliate leaves with three lance-shaped leaflets. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
